Project Proposed by Calvin Cheng cxcheng@...

Objectives
==========

The existing bench tests, while providing some automation in terms of
peer
bootstrapping, require manual configuration for each test peer. This is
laborious and impractical for larger network configuration of peers. It
is
also hoped that with a more generic API that we can provide an easier
mechanism for which a larger class of distributed tests can be written,
contributing to better quality and scalability of the JXTA platform and
externally developed JXTA applications.

Goals are stated below.

. To provide a more automated and easier-to-use replacement for
the existing
load test under the bench project.
. To provide a generic test harness/platform for which functional
tests can
be developed and run systematically.

Overview
========

The project provides a component to automatically create and configure a
testing network of peers, given a set up user-defined network
configuration
and test advertisements. The test peers may consist of any
user-definable
number and kind of JXTA peers. Each test peer is automatically
bootstrapped
to run a user configurable and written junit.framework.TestCase
instance. A
control peer initiates the distributed test sequence and monitors and
controls the state of the other test peers. A test API is provided to
aid
the test writer in developing tests.
The existing load test code from the bench project
(http://bench.jxta.org)
would be ported to run on JDF.

Status
======

High-level design document on the way. Some implementation prototyping
work
on peer creation and configuration has been done.
